author: Zeroroute

text: I beat the game for the first time the weekend before last. I knew what was gonna happen thanks to the internet, but when pokey turned off the devil's machine, a bunch of tension built up inside me. It was like staring at death itself, and I felt like this was no longer a game. I felt like a parental figure to the party, who at that point seemed like real people to me. The game immersed to me to the point it no longer felt like a game;I felt like the apocalypse would occur had I not...
author: Zeroroute

text: Actually, the screaming head of Giygas is a dead fetus. Itoi was traumatized after watching an extremely intense scene from a movie as a child. it was (i theorized) to be a women getting raped(yes that is it) and she was pregnant(my theory) I cant remember about the Fetus.

author: Marquis Elmdore

text:
His backstory is even about hate.
For whatever reason, he hated the woman who found him and treated him as her child. When you defeat him as Guige in Mother, it's because the 8 melodies remind him of the love he felt for her and it weakens him. He was so repulsed by this, he expunged all love from his heart, becoming a being of pure hate.

author: WingZero351

text: Porky originally.  Pokey is a typo.
author: WingZero351

text:
Yeah, though I don't let that stop me from enjoying those stories.

This may seem random, but I have actually been trying to write a time travel story that makes sense, so I've gotten to the point where I notice all sorts of paradoxes in those stories.

Here's another marvelous example: Buzz Buzz went back in time to stop Giygas from unleashing devastation upon the future, but that means the future was saved, giving Buzz Buzz no reason to go back and tell Ness the story. =D
author: Nathan Blair

text:
Well, I've never heard of Porky being a "king in all times." I suppose him going to points in time that took place before his birth is a question of whether or not Porky's position in the timeline has an effect on his body's aging process, which it clearly does.

On the other hand, I LOVE time travel, and always have. :D Definitely my favorite science fiction plot device.
author: Nathan Blair

text:
Well, that's still a paradox... if they killed Giygas as a fetus, then that would mean Giygas pretty much never existed at all (also meaning that Mother 1 didn't happen) and never became an enemy of Ness and friends, thus meaning they didn't kill him and he IS alive, in turn meaning they DID kill him. So, the theory about EarthBound's final battle being an abortion is nonsense.

Also, how is Porky in Mother 3 a time paradox?
author: Nathan Blair

text: Well, that's a bit of a time paradox. Although, EarthBound sort of is, anyway... it's pretty hard to have time travel into the past without creating situations that don't make sense.
author: Nathan Blair

author: Airking4321

text: porky is suprised that ness actually beat giygas, and is kinda happy, but still obsessive and hating, but suprised that ness had the courage to beat what porky unleashed and was terrified of, so he tells ness "whos the cool guy now?!" trying to say that he was under control and knew everything that was happening, but in real life, he was just a seriously messed up kid who had his bottled up anger released by mani mani and claimed he  worked with giygas, and took a bite bigger than he could chew.
author: Airking4321

text: so giygas is unleashed and porky is dealing with something that was too powerful for him, because he didn't know, and when he says "my heart is beating incredibly fast, i must be terrified!" he is, but he's trying to make himself sound cool, and when he says "go cry to mommy and daddy!" something like that, he'd actually want to do that, but he can't cause his parents wouldnt even bother to save him, so he makes fun of ness to make himself feel better and when giygas dies...
author: Airking4321

text: where he has time traveled enough that his body has aged a bit, and his skin turned blue, but he is influenced enough by mani mani that he actually will attack ness directly, and when defeated, he decides that he'll just turn off the devils machine and see what happens, but he never knew ANYTHING about giygas, he was dealing with power he didn't even understand. so then giygas starts to form, and porky makes up things about how "you will be another meal" when he doesnt even know what will happen
author: Airking4321

text: and flies away, steals that time phazer thing, and crashes in the deep darkness, where he starts to time travel back and forth, gaining that futuristic walker and he possibly met giygas in the past, although giygas was probs not aware of porky actually being a minion, porky probably just SAID that he has been helping giygas, u know like a poser, and later when ness came back to the past, porky was there waiting for him, to come, and the final fight starts,
author: Airking4321

text: then he and his father live in fourside, being rich, which accounts for his ritzy red suit, and he still tries to kinda be friends with ness, but i guess something happened with him and the mani mani statue, so that he realized his true evil and desire to rule, but he still had the friend-rival obsession with ness, but he was aware of giygas now, and decided he could use his power to rule the world, so the mani mani statue caused him to act even worse than he usually does, so he steals the heli,
author: Airking4321

text: and then he tries to follow ness, maybe to just be around him, so porky feels like he's ness's "friend" but also beat him so he feels his parents are happy, like a weird compromise in his head, kinda like if your parents started to hate your best friend, and you'd want to approve to your parents too, so you pretend to hate your friend. like porky. anyway, he follows ness and accidently becomes a cult priest, and "tries" to beat ness, and later his dad gains a well paying job in fourside, so....
author: Airking4321

text: but also in the beginning, porky wanted to be friends with ness, but then his parents started beating and punishing him, so porky felt that if he beat up ness, he'd earn his parents love, but he still wanted to be friends with ness, so it created a "friend-rival" relationship with him, which starts his weird obsession with ness.

If you pay attention to the seemingly useless babble Pokey spews right after phase 1 of the final battle, he states that Giygas had gained so much power, he destroyed his mind and physical being. This is why he is not aware of who he is, where he is, and what he's doing.

The game never really tells you how far back in time you are sent when you get into the Phase Distorter. Logically, it would have to be sometime AFTER Mother ended, since Giygas has his mind and body in Mother.

text: He's just a baby. If you would play it, you would know that to fight Giygas and actually win, you have to go back in time to where he was easier to beat. It seems nobody around here remebers the Phase Distorter and what it was for. Since you've seen a clip of beating Giygas, you noticed Ness and Co. were robots, right? Dr. Andonuts said that the human body cannot withstand time travel so he put their souls in those robots so they could get there alive. The Phase Distorter was a time machine.

author: xXBR4D3NXx

author: xXBR4D3NXx

text:
**SPOILERS AHOY**

It's simple, really. Giygas's physical form was completely and utterly destroyed. All that was left was his spirit; an entity of complete and total evil. This is pretty much why you can only beat him by using Pray (also Brainshock to try and hinder his ability to hurt the party).

Long story short, you're fighting Giygas's ghost.
author: t3hp0larbear

text: In short, he's not a fetus.  He was an alien at first, but his negative emotions drove him to become evil incarnate.  In the game, he's the background, what we're viewing in the video.

Like I said before, all that's there is Giygas. That's what you're fighting. Yes, he does change form as you hurt him more.

text: "The names of the parts they look like are irrelevant," what? That's not his chin that's connected to the umbilical chord, his chin is under his teeth. The umbilical cord is what it is. Yes, there are many things that can be considered life support systems but a whom definitely is one. Think, without it the fetus/baby would die: it nurtures the being inside by keeping it warm, feeding, and protecting it from the outside world.
author: xXBR4D3NXx

author: xXBR4D3NXx

author: The_KJB

text:
I actually know of a Final Fantasy 7 fanboy who watched alot of Evangelion and he doesn't over complicate a game's storyline.

If anything, your more likely to find such things from anyone who gets way to deep into time travel, such as Chrono Trigger fanboys, Back to the Future fanboys.  Many a Scifi fan who never touched any of the stuff you mentioned would create such an idea.  So, your generalization is quite unfounded by an "anti-weeaboo" state of mind you carry.
author: Neko Vermillion

text: They're all anime fans who watch a lot of Evangelion and play Final Fantasy 7 and think that EVERY STORY NEEDS TO BE LIKE THAT. They're stupid.
